Articles.Content:
I was wondering how many of you guys are part of the amateur radio service. My callsign is KD2KDG, and like some other threads I saw (Boy Scouts, etc.) I figured that the two hobbies would frequently cross. It would be cool to see some of you guys on HF!

Edited January 22, 2016 by waterlubber
Yes, but ... I let my license lapse, I believe I need to file some paperwork with the RSGB to make it valid again. Still got my FT-817 just waiting to be dusted off.

KA5ONF - but that was 20 something years ago. Dad was NC5J and mom was NC5I. Would like to get back into it sometime, but I'm gonna have to find one of those round tuits. Intersting/ I've kinda thought amateur radio was the first internet. We had more than one teletype setup. The first was was similar to this, not so big :

 

Spoiler

http://www.w8np.org/m28.jpg

The second setup used a commodore 64. Could actually read on the monitor and send with keyboard. I always thought the teletype sounded very much like dial-up. Wow, been a long time ago, memories.

I'm licensed, but pretty much inactive.  I've only really messed around on local 2m repeaters.

Life keeps seeming to get in the way every time my interest starts picking up.
FYI I read the title and thought it was a food mod. XD
